name: Styler
description:
Styler is a plugin for Figma that generates styles based on selected layers.

Basically, you can control your styles by changing layer properties and updating the styles.


Features

  • Generate Styles
  • Apply Styles
  • Detach Styles
  • Remove Styles
  • Extract Styles
  • Customize plugin


Notes

  1. It is much faster to use bulk rename feature in Figma to rename layers Cmd R (Mac) or Ctrl R (Windows)
  2. Try to avoid same name for multiple layers. It will create a single style, but it will update its properties
  3. By prefixing a text layer with "+" (plus sign), you can generate, apply, remove, detach all available properties of the text layer


Some ideas for future changes

Those are still an open topic and I'll have to research a little bit to see if all of them have sense and will be helpful. Most of these ideas were already requested by some people.

  1. Update the code to be easier to expand and use something similar with the one from Automater (Rollup + Svelte).
  2. Change Apply styles to also match by layer properties. At first will be a perfect match, then will experiment with some degree of flexibility.
  3. Add independent commands for Create, Update, Rename.
  4. Testing some ideas of unlocking the ability to reorder the styles based on layer order.
  5. Improving Extract styles to be provide a better structure.
